item.title: AMD Announces New Ryzen 9000 CPUs At CES 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/amd-announces-new-ryzen-9000-cpus-at-ces-2025/

AMD has officially unveiled its new Ryzen 9000 CPUs during its press event at CES 2025 in Las Vegas.

AMD started with the reveal of the AMD Ryzen 9 9950X3D and Ryzen 9 9900X3D processors. Starting with the Ryzen 9 9950X3D, the high-end CPU features 16 cores with 32 threads. It also features up to 144MB in total cache thanks to 3D V-cache boosted CCDs (Core Chiplet Dies). Breaking the cache down, it’s 64MB Zen 5 CCDs and 64GB from X3D. There’s also 16mb L2 cache for the 144MB total. For everything it includes, the CPU carries a TDP of 170W.

The 9900X3D CPU comes in with a little less power, but not by much. The processor comes with 12 cores and 24 threads with 140MB of total cache and a 5.5GHz max clock speed. It has a TDP of 140W.

As far as performance is concerned, AMD says the new cards are up to 8% faster — on average — than the Ryzen 9 7950X3D. Some games like Black Myth Wukong only saw a 1% performance increase. Games like Counter-Strike 2, however, saw a 58% jump.

When comparing to Intel’s latest Core Ultra 285K CPU, AMD says the Ryzen 9950X3D sees an average performance increase of 20% at 1080p on high settings. Games like Final Fantasy 14, FarCry 6, and Watch Dogs: Legion were over 40% faster per AMD. Black Myth Wukong saw performance around the same while Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora performed slightly better.

Both of the new CPUs are scheduled to launch in March. An exact release date along with final pricing will be announced in the coming weeks.

What do you think of the new AMD Ryzen 9000 series CPUs, the Ryzen 9 9950X3D and 9900X3D? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming Forums.

For more Insider Gaming Tech, check out the latest rumors regarding a potential return of Valve Steam Machines. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: Intel “Committed” To Graphics Card Market Moving Forward
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/intel-committed-to-graphics-card-market-moving-forward/

Intel isn’t leaving the discrete graphics card market anytime soon. During the company’s CES 2025 keynote on Monday, Intel’s new co-CEO Michelle Johnston Holthaus said that the company remains “committed” to the market moving forward.

“I get this question a lot,” Holthaus said. “We are very committed to the discrete graphics market, and we will continue to make strategic investments in this direction.”

Intel launched its latest Arc Battlemage graphics card, the B580, last month for $249. The entry-level card features 20 Xe2 cores, 12GB of GDDR6 VRAM, and a 192-bit memory bus. The next Battlemage card, the B570, is scheduled to launch on January 16. That card will cost $219 and feature 10GB of GDDR6 VRAM and 18 Xe2 cores.

In addition to the new Battlemage cards, Intel is working on the next-gen Celestial and Druid cards. Those, however, are still years away. Intel has made it clear their goal isn’t to contend with cards like the Nvidia GeForce RTX 4090 and 5090. Instead, they want to give budget conscious PC users more options.

What do you think of Intel continuing on with graphics cards? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming Tech, check out the latest rumors regarding a potential return of Valve Steam Machines. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth PC System Requirements Are Out
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/final-fantasy-7-rebirth-pc-system-requirements-are-out/

The official Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth PC system requirements have been revealed for three graphics presets. 

Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth hits PC via Epic Games Store and Steam on January 23, 2025. Ahead of the release, we now know the recommended system requirements for the title. Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth PC system requirements have been divided into three graphics presets: Minimum (30fps/1080p), Recommended (60fps/1080p) and Ultra (60fps/2160p). However, players will have the option to customise further. 

Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth PC System Requirements

In other news, Stellar Blade employees have received PS5 Pros and a cash bonus for this New Year’s. Also, Marvel Rivals Season 1: Eternal Night Falls is arriving later this week. What are your thoughts on Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth’s PC System Requirements? Let us know in the comments or our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the images of the Nintendo Switch 2 joy-cons surfacing online. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Season 1 Eternal Night Falls Update: Release Date, Start Time & New Heroes & Leaks
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/marvel-rivals-season-1-eternal-night-falls-update/

The Marvel Rivals Season 1 Eternal Night Falls update is more star-studded than an all-star Avengers movie line-up, and we’ve got everything you need to know about the free-to-play shooter’s first major content injection.

Season 0 is coming to an end, sparking the beginning of a new chapter. Marvel Rivals has got off to a start so sharp even Blade would cower—joking, he would never do this. Rivals is the new kid on the block looking to stay and make its presence known until it matures into a wise Doctor Strange-esque figure. The first few weeks firmly established the hero shooter’s impressive player count, but Season 1 is the first real test.

Marvel Rivals Season 1 Eternal Night Falls isn’t make or break, but it could shape the F2P title’s future.

Marvel Rivals Season 1 Release Date

January 10 is the start date for Marvel Rivals Season 1 Eternal Night Falls, neatly coinciding with the end of Season 0.

The Marvel Rivals X social media channel posted a message on January 6 saying, “Season 1: Eternal Night Falls begins on Jan 10, 2025.”

If you’re familiar with any live-service shooter—Call of Duty, Fortnite, and Overwatch are common contemporaries—you’ll recognize the Battle Pass formula stays the same. Each pass has a counter showing you how many days are left. The final day allows the title to execute a seamless transition to the new season.

Some downtime or maintenance might happen, but otherwise, in this circumstance, we expect Marvel Rivals Season 0 to end with its timer on January 10, and Season 1 to get underway.

Marvel Rivals Season 1 Start Time

Season 1’s Eternal Night Falls commences at 1 AM PST / 3 AM CT / 4 AM ET / 9 AM GMT.

Again, the verification comes straight from the same X status cited above. Check out the start time specific to you, make sure everything is updated and ready to go, grab some chips, and be heroic.

New Heroes in Marvel Rivals Eternal Night Falls

The Fantastic Four featuring Mr Fantastic, the Invisible Woman, the Human Torch, and The Thing are the confirmed names making a spectacular entrance in Season 1. Also, Dracula has been outed as another potential character to use in the shooter.

We know this for definite as the Season 1: Eternal Night Falls Official Trailer showed off the fab foursome.

With Doctor Doom teased for weeks now, you feel it’s all coming to a head in Eternal Night Falls. The reveal also strongly insinuates Dracula as a villain: “The Fantastic Four join forces with iconic Marvel heroes, standing together in the epic battle to break the mystical darkness with science. Ignite the battle against Dracula with the Fantastic Four in Marvel Rivals!“

It remains to be seen if it’s just the Fantastic Four, or if Doctor Doom and Dracula are out for blood too.

Marvel Rivals Season 1 Leaks

Popular leaks suggest Ultron is another character set to join the fray, and a host of buffs & nerfs to key heroes are coming.

Ultron

A bunch of Marvel Rivals leaked character rumors are in the wild, but Ultron could be sooner rather than later. Renowned leaker Marvel Rivals – Leaks & Info thinks “Ultron releases Season 1 and he’s a Strategist.” Additionally, their leak also has a full look at Ultron’s abilities and difficulty rating of Two Stars.

Buffs & Leaks

The Marvel Rivals – Leaks & Info X page has also outed a ton of buffs and nerfs which could impact Rivals’s meta.

Here’s a quick look at the characters expected to be reworked in Season 1—for better or worse.

Buffs

  • Captain America
  • Cloak & Dagger
  • Storm
  • Venom
  • Wolverine

Nerfs

  • Hawkeye
  • Hela

Everything in this section is considered a leak until we hear more, so take the information with a pinch of salt for now.

Marvel Rivals Season 1: Eternal Night Falls is wasting no time adding content. It already looks like a stacked assortment of incomings, so let us know if you think the season is shaping up nicely, and who or what you hope to see in future updates. Be sure to check out how to get free skins in Marvel Rivals, and our best crosshair settings.

item.title: Xbox Cloud Gaming Coming To LG Smart TVs
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/xbox-cloud-gaming-coming-to-lg-smart-tvs/

Microsoft has announced that it is bringing Xbox Cloud Gaming to LG Smart TVs. The company says that the deal will bring the feature to new LG Smart TVs later this year.

With Xbox Cloud Gaming, LG Smart TV owners who are Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscribers will be able to stream games from the library within the gaming portal. In addition to games in the service, players will also be able to stream their select games that they happen to own on the TVs.

“This gives players even more choice in how they enjoy their favorite games,” Corporate Vice President of Xbox Lori Wright said. “We’ll share more details on the Xbox Cloud Gaming experience with LG TV in the coming months.”

It’s currently unclear if any older models — those released in 2024 and sooner — will get access to the feature in the future.

Are you going to pick up a new TV for Xbox Cloud Gaming? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the latest rumor suggesting the next Xbox console will come in 2026. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Stellar Blade Employees Receive PS5 Pros and a Cash Bonus for New Year’s
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/stellar-blade-employees-receive-ps5-pros-and-a-cash-bonus/

Stellar Blade devs Shift Up has gifted its employees PS5 Pros and a cash bonus during their New Year’s event. 

As revealed on the official Stellar Blade X account (formerly Twitter), Shift Up has provided its employees with a fantastic gift for this New Year. The developers have purchased a literal pile of PS5 Pros and are gifting them to all their employees so that they can experience Stellar Blade in 4K. The post also consists of a video showing each employee picking up their very own PS5 Pro. 

As spotted by VGC, a South Korean publication, Naver, revealed that the mid-gen refresh consoles were not the only gift Stellar Blade employees received for New Year’s. According to the report, all employees were also provided with a cash bonus of 5 million won (roughly 3,400 USD). A Shift Up official revealed that the purpose of this bonus was to “encourage talent”. 

In other news, check out Stellar Blade’s Christmas update, filled with new holiday content. Also, the developers are considering a PC release for the title in 2025. What are your thoughts on Stellar Blade employees receiving PS5 Pros? Let us know in the comments or our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the images of the Nintendo Switch 2 joy-cons surfacing online. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
